alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 15 at 1:20PM MDT until June 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will prevail across the area through at least Saturday, with gusty westerly winds during the afternoon and evening bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to much of north central and west central New Mexico. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains (Zone 126) through 9 pm MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 11 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
